meanings.definition: The quality or state of being barbarous.
meanings.sent1: The barbarousnesses of the ancient tribes were evident in their ruthless ways.
meanings.sent2: The barbarousnesses of war can have devastating effects on innocent civilians.
meanings.sent3: Despite its name, the Barbarousnesses Bakery actually sells delicious pastries.
meanings.sent4: The barbarousnesses of nature can be seen in the harsh realities of survival in the wild.
meanings.sent5: The barbarousnesses of history are a reminder of the dark side of humanity.

meanings.definition: Acts or behaviors that are cruel, brutal, or uncivilized.
meanings.sent1: The barbarousnesses of the dictator's regime were condemned by the international community.
meanings.sent2: Witnessing the barbarousnesses of the crime scene left the detectives shocked.
meanings.sent3: The barbarousnesses of the playground bully made the other children afraid to play outside.
meanings.sent4: The barbarousnesses of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The barbarousnesses of the villain's actions were met with justice in the end.
